meanings.definition: A thin stick used by a conductor to direct an orchestra.
meanings.sent1: The conductor waved the baton gracefully to guide the musicians.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra conductor held the baton firmly in his hand.
meanings.sent3: The baton twirled in the air as the music filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: Her baton seemed to dance along with the melody of the symphony.
meanings.sent5: The shiny baton gleamed under the stage lights, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A short stick passed from runner to runner in a relay race.
meanings.sent1: The baton smoothly transferred from one sprinter to the next.
meanings.sent2: The relay team practiced passing the baton quickly to avoid dropping it.
meanings.sent3: During the race, the baton almost slipped from the athlete's hand but was caught just in time.
meanings.sent4: The baton became a symbol of teamwork as it traveled between the runners.
meanings.sent5: The baton relayed the energy of each runner as it made its way around the track.

meanings.definition: A stick or staff carried as a symbol of authority.
meanings.sent1: The king held the golden baton as a sign of his power and leadership.
meanings.sent2: The queen's baton was adorned with intricate designs, symbolizing her reign.
meanings.sent3: The mayor jokingly pretended the baton was a magic wand during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The baton of authority was passed down through generations in the royal family.
meanings.sent5: The baton represented the ruler's command over the kingdom, instilling respect in all who saw it.
